sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```text
       A----B
      / \   |
     /   \  |
    C-----D-E
```

What is the maximum number of edges that can be selected in this graph to create a perfect matching?
message_2:
A perfect matching is a set of edges in which every vertex is incident to exactly one edge in the set, and no two edges share a vertex.

In this graph, the maximum number of edges that can be selected to create a perfect matching is 2. One possible perfect matching is the set of edges {A-C, B-E}. Another possible perfect matching is the set of edges {A-D, B-E}.
